duration_in_months: ;}But before that, let us first identify and summarize the key points of this contract request. Below are the key elements:Summary of the key elements: This is a Request for Proposal (RFP) notice issued by Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) on August 16, 2022, which expires on September 6, 2022, at 4:00 PM (Local Time). The proposal is for a Structural Engineering Services (Consultant) for the CCG base in Hay River, Northwest Territories. The proposal is an open bidding process, and all interested suppliers may submit a bid. The service required includes conducting a structural condition assessment to establish the condition of 8 buildings and determine if remedial interventions may be required to maintain continued operations and functionality. Requirements include a multi-disciplinary team of sub-consultants and expertise in structural engineering services The selection process is a best overall proposal, and bidders are required to submit a separate sealed envelope for their cost proposal, excluding fees or costs related to the technical portion of the proposal. full_summary:
===============

# Hay River Canadian Coast Guard Base Structural Condition Assessment, Northwest Territories

---

## Request for Proposal: A Structural Engineering Firm for Assessing the Condition of 8 Buildings at the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) Hay River Base

The Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites proposals from qualified structural engineering firms to assess the structural condition of 8 buildings located at the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) Hay River Base in the Northwest Territories.

## Contract Details

*   Solicitation number: EW038-230558/A
*   Closing date: 06 September 2022, at 16:00 (MT)
*   Contracting Entity: Public Works and Government Services Canada
*   Contact: Alexandre Tikhonovitch, PWGSC Supply Specialist, Phone: 780-901-7940, Fax: 418-566-6167, Email: [Alex.Tikhonovitch@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca](mailto:Alex.Tikhonovitch@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca)

## Requirements

The project requires the services of a qualified structural engineering firm to assess the structural condition of 8 buildings at the CCG Hay River Base. This assessment will determine the necessary structural interventions to correct deficiencies and ensure the continued operation and functionality of the buildings.

## Proposal Guidelines

The proposal is a one-stage, one-phase selection process. The proponent must submit all technical information as phase 1, and a separate sealed envelope containing their cost proposal. The proponent must ensure that information related to fees or costs is not included with the technical portion of the proposal.

## Important Notes

Due to the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, the bid receiving unit in Edmonton will remain open but with limited staff and limited hours. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

## How to Obtain Bid Documents

Bid documents can be obtained through the Government of Canada Web site at [http://buyandsell.gc.ca/procurement-data/tenders](http://buyandsell.gc.ca/procurement-data/tenders). Suppliers who obtain bid documents from a source other than the official site may not receive a complete package. Suppliers must ensure that the bid is delivered on time.

## Inquiry Process

Inquiries should be directed to Alexandre Tikhonovitch, PWGSC Supply Specialist, Fax: 418-566-6167, Email: [Alex.Tikhonov
